label: Description
value: Stylized over-all repeat of Pawlonia leaf and flowers in continuous scrolls.

value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave, indigo dyed, resist applied by stencil (katazome)

label: Description
value: Length of resist-dyed cotton with broad sweeping water forms framing two turtles swimming toward each other, with flowering plum and pine branches. In white, gray and black on a blue ground.

value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave, patterned with stencil-applied paste resist (katazome) indigo dyed

label: Description
value: Oval and circular floral rosettes in dotted goemetrical framework, forming overall pattern, In white with occasional hand application of orange, on blue ground.

value: Medium: cotton Technique: plain weave, indigo dyed, resist applied with stencil (katazome)

label: Description
value: Figural groups from Burmese iconography, in close-set vertical repeat about 16" high. Blue ground, right half textured with tiny white dots and left half with faint yellow bars suggesting architectural framework. Reds browns, and tans. two wide cloth selvedges with double warps.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, vegetable dyes Technique: printed

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 79 x 77 cm (31 1/8 x 30 1/4 in.) Repeat H: 40.6 cm (16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Purchased from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: Flat circular base, narrow knobbed stem and flaring "tulip" - type top of opal and amber glass, with green speckles and stripes on base and stem, forming veins of petal-like shape on top.

label: Provenance
value: 1956: acquired by Museum (from Maud E. Dillard)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Georgiana L. McClellan

label: Description
value: Silk brocade with a loose lattice framework formed of naturalistic flowers and leaves, in pale greens, pinks and oranges on an off-white ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: woven with continuous and discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Marie Torrance Hadden

label: Description
value: Small rectangular painting on vellum, showing an orange tree in a tub set in a flowered landscape, is imposed on a silhouette cut-out showing curtains, doves, rampant lions and a crown.  The whole attached to a pink paper ground with escolloped edges.  Gilt paper and paint outline the various members of the cut-out.

label: Dimensions
value: Central panel: 11 x 9 cm (4 5/16 x 3 9/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Vertical serpentines of flowers form an ogival framework for vignette of dancing couple along with two small animals playing the drum and zither. German verse appears below the dancing couple. Printed in reddish-brown on natural linen ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 120 x 71 cm (47 1/4 x 27 15/16 in.)

label: Notes
value: Vertical serpentines of flowers form an ogival framework for vignette of dancing couple along with two small animals playing the drum and zither. German verse appears below the dancing couple. Printed in reddish-brown on natural linen ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: stenciled on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: a) Is located in Applied Arts Dept. Rectangular box, slightly curved, with rounded corners and hinged cover. Guilloche pattern with rosettes in niello on cover and bottom, diaper pattern on sides. Inside gilt. Marks: St. George, maker's initials "F.L.", silver content 84, and date 1836. b,c) Rectangular box and cover. Glossy or satin white ground and flocking, block printed in shades of pink, blue and green distemper colors. Remains of a red wax seal on the cover.

label: Provenance
value: Belonged to grandfather of donor, Jacob Lang (1813-1846) of Danville, Pennsylvania.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Minnette Lang, in memory of her father, Otto J. Lang

label: Description
value: Asymmetrical flat bowl with one point, and five ogee lobes on one side and one on the other, the whole gilded. Stem, pierced in radiating design. Handle flat and angular, ending in thistle flower. Relief interlacing with trefoil reserve containing monogram JAD.

label: Description
value: A silver hoop with molded decoration on both edges holds the lens in a groove. It screws into a handle with repoussé shells, cherub heads, cartouches and flowers.

label: Description
value: Part a, square marble plinth supporting gilt bronze tripod with lions feet and heads; snake twisted around center stem; marble bowl mounted in wide band; double chains hanging from ring held by lions' heads. Part b, dome-shaped marble lid with gilt bronze pine cone finial; interior fitted with gilt bronze nozzle for candle (can be inverted to act as candle holder).

label: Description
value: Handle with silver overlay on mother-of -pearl, the silver as chased foliage, flowers and vines.  Marked "Gorham Mfg. Co. STERLING" on steel base.

label: Description
value: Ovoid bowl with frosted finish to interior. Tapering stem with small gadrooned knop below the pointed, rounded terminal which is stamped with scrolling vines and a dove on a matted ground. Obverse with monogrammed trefoil-topped heart-shaped reserve.

label: Description
value: Octagonal basket with flaring sides pierced in bands of lancets and circles. Four ball feet.

label: Description
value: Orb-shaped infuser with chain; stand with wire work support on circular dish with scroll border.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam. (tea infuser): 6.1 x 5 cm (2 3/8 x 1 15/16 in.) H x diam. (stand): 1.3 x 7.6 cm (1/2 in. x 3 in.)

value: Flat pocket of hand-woven fabric, embroidered in a floral design in colored wools. Bound at edges and at opening for hand in fragments of dark, block-printed linen. Waist tapes are missing.
